t: And*p I saw in the right hand*i of Him who sat on the throne a scroll written inside and on the back, sealed with seven seals.
Then I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, “Who is worthy to open the scroll and to loose its seals?”
And no one in heaven or on the earth or under the earth was able to open the scroll, or to look at it.
So*p I wept much, because no one was found worthy to open and read the scroll, or to look at it.
But one of the elders said to me, “Do not weep. Behold, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has prevailed to open the scroll and to loose its seven seals.”

And*p I looked, and behold, in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as though it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent out into all the earth.
Then He came and took the scroll out of the right hand of Him who sat on the throne.

Now*p when He had taken the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each having a harp, and golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.

And they sang a new song, saying: “You*pn are worthy to take the scroll, And*ld to open its seals; For*ld You were slain, And*ld have redeemed us to God by Your blood Out*ld of every tribe and tongue and people and nation,
And*ld have made us kings and priests to our God; And*ld we shall reign on the earth.”
Then*p I looked, and I heard the voice of many angels around the throne, the living creatures, and the elders; and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands,
saying with a loud voice: “Worthy*pn is the Lamb who was slain To*ld receive power and riches and wisdom, And*ld strength and honor and glory and blessing!”

And*p every creature which is in heaven and on the earth and under the earth and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, I heard saying: “Blessing*pn and honor and glory and power Be*ild to Him who sits on the throne, And*ld to the Lamb, forever and ever!”
Then*p the four living creatures said, “Amen!” And the twenty-four elders fell down and worshiped Him who lives forever and ever.
